pullRequest.title: Uyuni issue 10893 supportconfig speedup
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
Optimization on spacewalk-debug which will reflect also in optimizations on supportconfig generation.
Main changes on spacewalk-debug:

Clean "spacewalk-debug" working dir before start.
Exclude schema upgrade files
Add flag to not compress output folder

The default behavior will be kept and the output will be a tar file with all the data.
Supportconfig sets the property --no-compression to true and avoid double compression execution on spacewalk-debug.
Manual test:
Log directory with 1 Gb.
Times before:
real	10m56.993s
user	9m34.576s
sys	0m20.524s

Times after:
real	9m20.605s
user	8m2.152s
sys	0m20.248s

GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: internal tool changes only.


 DONE


Test coverage


No tests: this tool doesn't have automatic tests


 DONE


Links
Fixes SUSE/spacewalk#10893
Tracks SUSE/spacewalk#10798
4.0: SUSE/spacewalk#11579

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_lint_checkstyle"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "ruby_rubocop"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

beforeCommit.message:
spacewalk-debug/supportconfig speedup fixes and --no-compression flag

Speedup of the spacewalk-debug by excluding the schema-upgrade directory.

Add flag to not compress the output folder.
Useful for support config since it will compress it output, avoid trying to compress twice.
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Mateus <rmateus@suse.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Hmm, I am not 100% sure if this is a good idea, because you never know if a customer messed around with it.
But I tend to agree that in such a case we might need to ask explicit for that content.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -130,6 +137,8 @@ elif [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then
 fi
 cp -fapRd /etc/rhn $DIR/conf/rhn
 cp -fapRd /etc/sysconfig/rhn $DIR/conf/rhn/sysconfig
+# exclude schema upgrade files, as they are packaged
+rm -r $DIR/conf/rhn/sysconfig/rhn/schema-upgrade

commit.message:
spacewalk-debug --no-report parameter can now be passed in any order

spacewalk-debug have a bug which not allows the parameter --no-report to be pass in any order.
Example: spacewalk-debug --no-reports --dir /tmp/

Signed-off-by: Ricardo Mateus <rmateus@suse.com>

spacewalk-debug/supportconfig speedup fixes and --no-compression flag
